reviews.text: Really beautiful and in the heart of the city. You can walk from there to everything else in a circle a you will see everything that Dresden has to offer. There are pieces from the old church on the outside! If you head over there on Christmas time, check out their Christmas market it's small, but it's really beautiful. Try some of the locals favorites and enjoy it. Dresden is beautiful!

Beautiful "new" Lutheran Church, rebuilt fairly recently after the old one was destroyed in WWII. It's neat that architects and engineers used computer simulations of the destruction in order to incorporate the rubble into the reconstruction. You can tell the original stones because they are darker in colour than the rest.

Beautiful historical church with many events. (Open to visitors only a few hours a day on weekends.)
Viewing platform in the dome.
Touching exhibits in the crypt about its rebuilding after the bombing of Dresden.
The circolar and high Church. Beautiful incredible. Fantastic and magician Church in wonderful place Frauenkirche with many others beautiful building.
a very well preserved church. a centerpiece in Dresden. man can not miss it. If you are in or near Dresen, you have to visit

Awesome experience!   We saw Figaro...I expected to fall asleep three times but only fell asleep twice!  Not bad for a three and a half hour show.  

Seriously, though, this opera house is an amazing sight to see.  It was rebuilt to the original specs in 1977.
Always a nice view inside and outside. Take a guided tour for the opera in the morning and a walk along the Elbe at the afternoon.

Amazing experience in Dresden. We went there to watch la boheme and it was amazing. The old building looks impressive from the outside but from the inside it is absolutely stunning. The restoration was done incredibly well and is really a sight to behold. The cast of the opera was also very well picked. All around an amazing evening
Beautiful and iconic opera house.  Wish I could have taken the tour and seen an opera.
Watched La Bohéme and it was great! I have seen many operas but its seldom that one has me this emotional!
exterior very laconic
Ein schöner Ort um etwas mehr darüber zu erfahren.

בית הכנסת החדש של דרזדן נבנה על חורבות בית הכנסת הישן (נחרב בליל הבדולח 9 נוב' 1938) בית הכנסת החדש כולל שני מבנים- באחד- אולם התפילה ובשני מבנה הקהילה היהודית. לצערי בבית הכנסת מתקיימים לימודי תיכון, ככה שהכניסה לא אפשרית בכל עת, ממליץ לגשת למבנה הקהילתי ולבקש לצפות. ציון דרך חשוב בהיסטוריה של יהדות דרזדן ובכלל בהיסטוריה היהודית. בית הכנסת משתייך ככל הנראה לזרם אורתודוקסי מודרני.
Die Synagoge ist sehr modern, dennoch besonders und sehenswert. Leider war die Führung sehr langatmig.
בית כנסת בבנייה אורתודקסית עם תפילות ליברליות נבנה מההריסות של הבית כנסת הישן שנהרס על ידי הנאצים מקום מאוד יפה גדול מרווח שווה ביקור

The beautiful Elbe river in front and the historic old buildings on the back, the vast green bank with soothing greenery on the other side of the river; this place is breathtaking in every season, every weather, and every time of the day.
The terrace has many places to stroll or sit in sunlight as well as in the shadow of trees. The terrace is surrounded by beautiful sandstone buildings, the historical and architectural marvels. It's a great attraction point for an architecture enthusiast.
The river bank has ports from where you can take ferry rides up and down the river. There are also some places to eat and drink with outdoor seating and nice views.
Great view over the river and the right bank part of the city.
Nice place to walk around and have a beautiful view of the river Elbe and the other side of the city. It's near the center and pretty much everything around is worth watching, so don't miss it.
Amazing view. An eye catcher!
Wonderful panoramic with building artistic and historical famous

Nice shop. But it is on the route of the sightseeing hop on hop off bus which brings a crowd every 30 minutes. Make sure that you will visit it between these peak moments. You can buy there some cheese and dairy products and some souvenirs. In the first floor there is a restaurant, I had very delicious meal there.

An amazing shop with an upstairs restaurant out from the hustle and bustle of the main city, a MUST when in Dresden. The menu had plenty of choice but we opted for the cheese platter and thoroughly enjoyed everything. Yes it does get budy, but be patient to try to take in the wonderful decor, every inch a piece of untouched history that thankfully wasn't destroyed during the war.

Excellent if you like traditional dairy products. Not exactly the place for lactose intolerance, but you might be persuaded to suffer the pain for their cheese selection or fresh milk. I opted for the kaffee creme. The restaurant is great for the winter months. Ox tail soup etc. There is an English translation menu. Not much for the gluten free though.

Very nice cafe but I didn’t get to eat anything, just went there for photo but it seemed that they don’t allow taking pictures inside the cafe but still many people were taking photos -“-. And there was too many people queuing up. Try to avoid peak time.

It's a historical place.  The shop downstairs is rather small but it is beautifully decorated with porcelain tiles.  If you see a tour bus outside wait a few minutes for them to leave or you'll never get inside.  We had lunch upstairs in the cafe.  In general food was nothing special and very overpriced.  We did, however, order the cheese plate and it was very good.
It is a very nice park in Dresden, not every touring know this place. You can take a ride of a cute railway that is partly operated by children. There is no other better place in the summer!

How fantastic.

My Children want always to go there. There is no reason to be careful with your car.

Just feel free and enjoy!
Amazing place to visit in spring season 💜💚💙
Beautiful place, I went in winter and it's really nice
I totally loved it super tranquil place
It is a unique place! As for men, I think it is the first place to visit in Dresden. You will be involved in the manufacturing process of electric car and for sure you’ll enjoy it.
Very interesting place! Must visit in Dresden. It is so clean and inside you can take an excursions a look at the whole manufacturing process. It is not allowed to take a photo.
Great experience, take the guided tour to know the process of assembling a car and the brand new features for electric and autonomous cars.
Impressive glass design and the phaeton brand factory.

I never thought that I would actually be excited about a car manufacture. But this one is special, as the guided tour lets you walk through the production, and you get to see how the electric golf gets put together piece by piece, partly by workers, but also by robots. Also has an exhibit about the future of mobility worth seeing as well.
Its a great trip to have. Thanks to my friend Laura fro exploring it. Lesser know place. You should get a ticket for it.. As far as I know it's 10-15 euro.. not sure.. It's a kind of Hanging tram.
Not much adventurous. But good.
Interesting and fun, with great views at the top. In summer it gets very warm inside the carriages, take note.
What a nice place!
Excellent. Friendly staff. Great displays.

On a scale of small to huge, this HUGE.  So much to see inside and out, the largest camellia in the world, beautifully manicured grounds (too big to be a garden!) waterfront location and good quality eateries. A must do when visiting this part of Germany. STEEPED in history.

Probably the most beatiful castle around Dresden!on the banks of the river Elbe..with an amazing inner garden!
My place to visit in the summer when looking to lay down a blancket and enjoy the silence and the sun!
Totally recomend it!
Cool area to check and have a wine!
Very nice and serene place on the outskirt of Dresden. 😊

Beautiful picturesque gardens and amazing refurbished historic buildings. Unfortunately we haven't been inside the castle (no dogs allowed) but the gardens are very nice indeed and not many tourists around which we appreciated.
Downside: you got to pay for everything (parking, entrance and toilets)?! Come on: at least the toilets can be for free! Tipp: we sneaked in without paying (toilets are not manned).
Wunderbare Kunsthalle! Absolute Empfehlung!

It is a nice stop. It doesn't take that long and there is a lot to see and hear.

You are running around in the remains of an old castle protection belt. The place itself is history and they have exhibits and items from many time periods.
You learn about the discovery of white gold in the western world how the city was protected and some politics and city building strategies and ...

Don't worry they don't get into it to much it is just really entertainment and some party knowledge.
Nice to spend a hour ot two and learn about the history of the city. Cheap. Good audioguides.
Really big art museum

Na ja, die Bezeichnung FESTUNG weckt räumliche Vorstellungen, die von Anfang an auch nicht annähernd einzuhalten sind. Aber alle Räume sind liebevoll zurecht gemacht, die Führung war äußerst sachkundig. Gehört dennoch wohl eher nicht zu den TOP 20 Sehenswürdigkeiten in Dresden.

Na da habe ich ja richtiges Schwein gehabt, dass ich gleich zweimal die alte Festungsanlage angeschaut habe. Das alte Stadttor und die Kasamten sind aber auch imposant. Obwohl man zwar von der Brühlschen Terrasse kurz in einen kleinen Innenhof reinschielen kann, wird einem das Ausmaß der Anlage erst bei einer Besichtigung bewußt.
Not much of a museum, but great if you like reading because it's full of his books and books related to him.

Amazing museum, but just a few English content and subscription. The staff is really kind and friendly (in English, too)
And finally a place where they put the soap above  the trash so it won't go everywhere!

Ein kleines, aber sehr sympathisches Museum. Der Aufbau hat uns persönlich gut gefallen und für Kästner-Fans absolut empfehlenswert. Vorn Museum kann man den Jungen Kästner auf den Albert Platz blicken sehen.

Wir haben es genossen die Urkunden, Bücher und Gegenstände zu durchforsten.
Haben mit 4 Personen eine Lesung besucht, die auf hohem Niveau war. Gab auch genügend Aussprache. Es gab gut Getränke und geschmackvoll Kekse, die gut gegen Hunger geholfen haben ( nicht zu süß)

Ein nettes kleines Museum mit sehr freundlichen Mitarbeitern und einem für mich komplett neuen Konzept: die Texte und Fotos finden sich überwiegend in zahlreichen kleinen Schubladen. Irgendwie wirkte das Museum aber zu klein für einen so großen Mann. Ich hätte mir noch ein bisschen mehr Räume und ein paar größere Objekte gewünscht, wie z.B. ein typisches Arbeitszimmer.

A little off the beaten track but worth the visit. Good combination of everything from tanks to history and aircraft. As you enter the main building you can see cannons and guns from the earlier times and on your right more modern equipment. Main building gives the early years which is impressive, sometimes with a English translation which makes things easier. The heating was on at a very toasty 24 deg a little warm this time of year. In the back of the building there is a courtyard full of varying equipment which sadly is decaying over time. There are three other buildings one on transport at the back which was locked at the time. One on aviation, and another on arms. Very impressive. Overall worth a visit for anyone with a military interest.

The museum is OK, reasonable amount of exhibits and plenty of old military vehicles in the courtyard. What lets it down are the lack of explanations relating to exhibits or anything else. No map provided to help patrons find particular exhibits/areas of interest, staff not unfriendly, nor enthusiastic or overly helpful. One certainly didn't meet anyone who had any passion for sharing history with patrons which has been commonplace at nearly every other museum one has visited in my lifetime. In comparison to other museums it's pretty poor but if you have time to kill and are in the area it's worth a visit, I wouldn't advise anyone to go out of their way to visit unless you are a huge fan of real life tanks and other military vehicles as seeing them up close in the flesh is really the only selling point of the place.

Great museum, but be aware there are not a lot of explanations inside. The museum assumes a good knowledge of the Romanian history.  The decaying military vehicles in the courtyard are very interesting to explore.

Great place to visit in Bucharest, hosting an impressive collection of objects from the Romanian military history. It covers all the historical times from the bronze age to contemporary present day. Make sure you also go to the courtyard behind the main building where for real size military equipments like tanks, guns, trucks & even aircrafts. 

As well, there are 3 other pavilions situated in the back of the main building that host collections of military transport vehicles & chariots, military uniforms & weapons. 

Prices range from 5 lei (children & students) to 20 lei (adults). Just make sure you have cash with you because you can't pay by card at the entrance.

A great museum where you can learn a lot about Romania's history from a military point of view. It features from crude stone tools to rockets used until the 1990's. Small scale fortification and castle models. A lot of maps and uniforms. And from small artillery guns that could be towed by horses to train fixed heavy artillery guns. Tanks, planes, armoured carriers old and relatively new.
There is a main museum, in another building a level for guns and a level for uniforms, another building for aviation related stuff and also one building.(which was closed) with parachutes and related material.

Was a great concert there this Sunday! Maybe get more young people there!
Have fun, greetings from Prague, Zbynek
Great insight into the person Carl-Maria von Weber and his correspondence!
Sehr schöne Atmosphäre. Man kann hier auch Konzerte veranstalten. Der Yamaha-Flügel ist sehr fein. Und sehr freundliche Mitarbeiter

Da wir im Carl-Maria-von-Weber Museum geheiratet haben waren wir vorher zu einem kurzen Gespräch dort um alle Feinheiten abzustimmen. Hinterher wurden uns sogar alle Räumlichkeiten gezeigt und wir bekamen einige interessante Informationen zu Weber und seinem Leben in diesem Haus in dem wir uns das Jawort gegeben haben. Noch nie war ein Museumsbesuch so interessant für mich.

Vielen Dank für die nette Betreuung, die private Führung und unseren schönsten Tag im Leben. 

Wir kommen gern einmal wieder und bringen etwas mehr Zeit mit für eine Führung.
Sehr gepflegt und schön. Als Standesamt einfach super

A great gallery, political involvement, invested in questions of the hour, along artist dignity and aesthetics of contemporary taste.
Cleverly done, check their public space projects too, and look up for their events
Closed till February 2019
Невеличкий музей, галерея. Рекомендую відвідати всім тим хто любить щось особливе.  Атмосфера тут панує чогось незвичного і таємного.
Sehr schön und gemütlich.

Das kleine, aber feine Museum, fast mehr eine Galerie, im Schatten der großen Dresdner Museen... aber was für ein Museum - für mich sind Ausstellungen und Veranstaltungen allererste 'Kunst': Kein Hochglanz, sondern eine sehr persönliche Atmosphäre. Nach langer unbewusster 'Ignoranz' für mich die Entdeckung seit langem. Ein Besuch lohnt sich hier auf jeden Fall: Persönliche Empfehlung!

Beautiful and important paintings, neatly organised and presented. A must see in Dresden!

Staff was quite rude and unhelpful
Excellent Italian masterpieces, but as students we were treated like special survilled. It's a shame because, of course, we paid the ticket and we deserved a better tratment
On of the best art galleries. Must see. Also it is recommended to download the audio guide in advance, so you will pay less!
Beautiful classical art museum. You must visit it if you love classical paintings.

Good paintings and art to visit. The staff is however very unfriendly and impolite especially when we do not know how to speak German. 
I was asking one of the staff about the chocolate smell I found interesting in the museum and he could not answer as he do not know English. That was still fine. However, my friend was simply lowered down his body a little and point at very very far distance from the paintings as he thought the smell was from the box underneath the paintings and the table and he was trying to tell me. We were then warned out of nothing by the impolite staff in German that we apparently could not understand at all. We did not even have any wrongdoings. The rest of the journey they keep following and watching us in the museum as if we were villain visiting the place. This was an extremely rude behaviour to us aa a tourist as we simply was interested in the arts and we were acting very respectfully towards everything in the museum. 
The extreme impolite staff that could not speak and understand English spoilt the experience in the museum. Very unfriendly towards non-German speaker. I will not waste my money to visit the place again.

Awesome experience!   We saw Figaro...I expected to fall asleep three times but only fell asleep twice!  Not bad for a three and a half hour show.  

Seriously, though, this opera house is an amazing sight to see.  It was rebuilt to the original specs in 1977.
Always a nice view inside and outside. Take a guided tour for the opera in the morning and a walk along the Elbe at the afternoon.

Amazing experience in Dresden. We went there to watch la boheme and it was amazing. The old building looks impressive from the outside but from the inside it is absolutely stunning. The restoration was done incredibly well and is really a sight to behold. The cast of the opera was also very well picked. All around an amazing evening
Beautiful and iconic opera house.  Wish I could have taken the tour and seen an opera.
Watched La Bohéme and it was great! I have seen many operas but its seldom that one has me this emotional!

A nice Oriental restaurant with great prices and daily specials including many vegetarian and vegan options. There are a few places to eat outside, as well as many tables inside. The inside is decorated with carved wood and mosaic tiles, which give it a nice charm. 
The dishes we ordered were served warm had generous portions with fresh ingredients. Our food was served quickly and the waitress was attentive and very friendly. All in all, our party of eight was pleasantly surprised by the food and service.
Delicious at a good price
Big plates, good quality
the best thing to get after a huge Hunger
Food very big and good tasty. Service nice and helpful. I can't give 5 stars because toilets are bad.
Fantastic dinner and an even better experience. The quality of the pork and bacon wrapped sausage with flavor & texture that's hard to put into words. My son and I had a wonderful meal.

Everything was DELICIOUS!! The fried circle potato’s (much like a hash brown) were super delicious! The Zander fish topped with Broccoli and cheese in a cheese sauce was AMAZING! I’d definitely recommend this meal!
Nice traditional place with hunting trophees and traditional food
Great German cousine. Very nice personal. Interesting hunter style furnishings.

Common place to eat. Inside the walls are covered by hunting examples. So if you are animal welfare specialist or has an idea about biodiversity protection, it is not your place. The prices are middle but the dishes are very big. One young guy working there is very polite and helpful.
Very good food and service
The best affordable place in Las Mercedes
Excelent place to eat Italian food
The best pizza in Mercedes neighborhood.
good for pizzas

Service was good, wait-staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and the ambiance is fun. The food, however, left a lot to be desired. 

Having worked in the industry for years, I can say the fries definitely come frozen. I'm willing to bet the same for the beef. The patties are identical and lack any real flavor. The burgers were simply mediocre at best. When the waitress told us that they only serve the meat well done, this should've set off a red flag but I didn't listen to my gut. 

In today's food-scene, one's burger game should be top notch especially considering the ratings this place has. Nevertheless, the quality of the product was simply unacceptable.
Avocado Burger with sweet potato fries... A W E S O M E !!! Service was fantastic and the atmosphere is super cool. Definitely a place to go for Burger-lovers.

Great quality burgers at a great price. It is also a good place to stay with friends at afternoon and drink some beers. This place is usually very crowded at weekend. No 5 stars because the menu is a little small. Only fries, burgers, salads and beverages. No starters like nachos or chicken fingers; hot dogs etc. And the tables are too close one to another.

Great food amd location. Nice atmosphere - artificial beech trees, nice lighting, decent seating. Great wait staff.  Would give it 5 stars if it weren't just hamburgers, though they are delicious! I really like this place.
very luxurious. good vegan options. lunch menu surprisingly cheap
Very impressive old-style restaurant. Portions are tasty and big.
Very friendly service. The information from the parking to the restaurant could be improved, dificult to find. Good traditional german food.
A lovely view of the Elbe River
Very tasty beer and and amazing atmosphere

A wonderful location, positioned beautifully at the end of a lovely walk up the Elbe from Dresden central. Good beer and a good choice of food. Reasonable prices for the location and plenty of seating.

A nice Oriental restaurant with great prices and daily specials including many vegetarian and vegan options. There are a few places to eat outside, as well as many tables inside. The inside is decorated with carved wood and mosaic tiles, which give it a nice charm. 
The dishes we ordered were served warm had generous portions with fresh ingredients. Our food was served quickly and the waitress was attentive and very friendly. All in all, our party of eight was pleasantly surprised by the food and service.
Delicious at a good price
Big plates, good quality
the best thing to get after a huge Hunger
Food very big and good tasty. Service nice and helpful. I can't give 5 stars because toilets are bad.

My favourite place to come and chill out over a veggie burger. The selection is great especially the veggie options, the staff are very nice and the atmosphere is nice. A good place to chill out with a book
Great burgers. Good Cocktails. Nice service

Great burgers. And fabulous juices. 
Fantastic service.
Good burger, also vegie selection
Ok food, nice personal!

This restaurant is right definition of heaven. The food is delicious I ordered the steak with vegetables, herbal butter and wine sauce.
The steak was medium and juice just like I love it, the vegetables were flavorful and the butter on top was just perfect.
On the side I've got some yummy yummy crunchy french fries.
Now that was the food, the view outside this place is breathtaking, it was freezing outside but I couldn't help standing there to take it all in.
Service: great, the waitress was super nice and patient.

Good place with nice view of the city, you can sit at the restaurant or on the grass, whatever you prefer! Great place to bring your kids, because there is a playground just next to the restaurant. Nice service and staff 👌

The best view of Bern and an amazing atmosphere with a wood fire place on the inside and an outside covered area. Good service with an adequate range of spirits and wines. The waitress who served us was very nice. Hence I would say good service.
Beautiful, warm and comfortable tables, indoors and partially outdoors. Food is tremendous. The lamb steak must try.

Fantastic panorama spot, wide view over Bern, 5 minutes walk from Bus parking and tourist information. Start your Bern visit here at this sunshine spot with a cup of coffee & regional cakes. People of Berne love it as well, often busy. Outdoor Playground directly beside it.

Laid-back and cosy atmosphere in low-light surroundings. Great pizza and the focaccia starters are simple but excellent. Prices are very reasonable. 
Service is friendly and the whole place has a homely feel.

Best Italian restaurant with value and taste. The most authentic Italian around Dresden and great staff and management! Skip the big Italian chains and keep it local. These guys have been here many years and it shows how different they are from the rest!
Would recommend!!!

One of the BEST pizzas I've ever had!
Their carbonara pasta was so and so...I'd definitely stick to pizzas in this restaurant.
The waiters were super nice and polite about us staying after opening hours.
Would definitely come back here again.
Their pizza is not to be missed out on...I still drool by by thought of it 😄

My kids love this place, mainly because they can speak Italian with the pizzaiolo. Impeccable service, very warm and welcoming. Pizza is good, with soft high rim and nice toppings. My daughter takes always spaghetti alla bolognese and she seems happy with that. I suggest antipasto with San Daniele focaccia.
Good Italian food in an easy atmosphere.
Great pizza and great price.
Tasty, fast and good prices
We tried bombay pizza with chicken. It was very good.
Very good pizza for the price
Fair price and very tasty, but halve of my pizza buns didn't get filling. (Still tasty)

We have not been here for a long time. Today we had a late lunch on a sunny Sunday afternoon. They have very charming / romanic seats outside (even for bigger parties) but unfortunately all are occupied. So we got a seat inside - the decor is also very nice for our taste. Most of the staff were very friendly but best of all was the food: Very tasty, not heavy with lots of herbs, lemon, fresh tasting ingredients - we loved it. The portions are just right and the pricing is fair. We will come back.

My favorite restaurant in Dresden. I've lived here for 5 years at this point, and have been disappointed by dozens of other places, but this restaurant is a gem in this city! Have been here many times and have never had a bad meal. Good, perfectly prepared, nicely presented and fairly priced dishes.
Excellent! Fantastic food.
Always an excellent option for lunch or dinner.
Lll
Dr. Fischer has been my doctor for many years. I have followed her practice through 2 counties and 3 locations! I could not imagine her not being my doctor! She is kind and compassionate.

Dr Fischer is the finest Doctor I have ever had.  She is quick to decide what to do and does it.  If it is something you are doing that is causing your symptoms, she will tell you that.  I have had her as my doctor since 1997 and have been blessed to have her watching over my health.
Very hard to get an appointment when needed.
Wonderful food in a very nice setting. I don't normally think of Italian food in East Germany, but they pulled it off nicely.
Everything is nice but the price we paid was way too high. I'm not sure what we paid so much for. The food was good, not great.
Awesome!
Great food and atmosphere

I can just talk about the brunch they offer on Sunday and holidays. In my opinion one of the best brunches available in Dresden if you like Italian food. It's definitely not the biggest selection, but the food is qualitative on a very high level. On the other side it's definitely not the cheapest offer in town. I liked it anyway.
